fields.description: Other
Improper Input Validation
Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')
Execution with Unnecessary Privileges
Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')
Improper Neutralization of Directives in Dynamically Evaluated Code ('Eval Injection')
Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor
Execution with Unnecessary Privileges
Incorrect Default Permissions
Improper Certificate Validation
Improper Validation of Certificate with Host Mismatch
Missing Encryption of Sensitive Data
Cleartext Storage of Sensitive Information
Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
Not Using a Random IV with CBC Mode
Use of Insufficiently Random Values
Declaration of Catch for Generic Exception
Deserialization of Untrusted Data
Exposure of Backup File to an Unauthorized Control Sphere
Insertion of Sensitive Information into Log File
Use of Potentially Dangerous Function
Exposed Dangerous Method or Function
Selection of Less-Secure Algorithm During Negotiation ('Algorithm Downgrade')
Use of RSA Algorithm without OAEP
Uncontrolled Memory Allocation
Weaknesses in Mobile Applications
Improper Export of Android Application Components
Improper Authorization in Handler for Custom URL Scheme
Improper Restriction of Rendered UI Layers or Frames

fields.default_description: The application uses insecure functions that could lead to arbitrary code execution.
fields.default_mitigation: Try to avoid the usage of insecure functions

fields.default_description: The application makes storages operations
fields.default_mitigation: The application must not read or write sensitive information

fields.default_description: The application is accessing network information
fields.default_mitigation: The application should access network information only if it is needed

fields.default_description: The application is accessing device information
fields.default_mitigation: The application should access the device information only if it is needed

fields.default_description: The application is accessing GPS information
fields.default_mitigation: The application should GPS information only if it is needed

fields.default_description: The application get information about installed application into the device
fields.default_mitigation: The application should not check other applications into the device

fields.default_description: There are hardcoded IPs into the source code
fields.default_mitigation: There must not be hardcoded IPs into the source code

fields.default_description: There are hardcoded URLs into the source code
fields.default_mitigation: There must not be hardcoded URLs into the source code

fields.default_description: There are hardcoded emails into the source code
fields.default_mitigation: There must not be hardcoded emails into the source code

fields.default_description: There are hardcoded NIF into the source code
fields.default_mitigation: There must not be hardcoded sensitive information into the source code

fields.default_description: There are hardcoded users into the source code
fields.default_mitigation: There must not be hardcoded users into the source code

fields.default_description: There are hardcoded passwords into the source code
fields.default_mitigation: There must not be hardcoded passwords into the source code

fields.default_description: There are sensitive information into the source code
fields.default_mitigation: There must not be sensitive information into the source code

fields.default_description: There are hardcoded connections into the source code
fields.default_mitigation: There must not be hardcoded connections into the source code

fields.default_description: There are WebViews in the application. Javascript code could be included and could be vulnerable to XSS injections
fields.default_mitigation: Code in WebViews must be validated to avoid injections

fields.default_description: The application is printing information. Check if there are information leak
fields.default_mitigation: Information on loggers or printed must be validated to avoid internal information leak

fields.default_description: App uses SQLite Database and execute raw SQL query. Untrusted user input in raw SQL queries can cause SQL Injection. Also sensitive information should be encrypted and written to the database.
fields.default_mitigation: Encrypt any sensitive information before saving into database and do not use raw sql queries

fields.default_description: The application is making HTTP requests
fields.default_mitigation: The application may be vulnerable to MITM attacks, check if the connections are secure.

fields.default_description: The application uses an insecure Random Generator
fields.default_mitigation: The application should use a secure random generator like java.security.SecureRandom

fields.default_description: The application contains HEX data
fields.default_mitigation: Hex data must never be used as an encryption method

fields.default_description: The application uses Base64 data
fields.default_mitigation: Hex data must never be used as an encryption method

fields.default_description: This application uses cryptography without padding. The purpose of the padding scheme is to prevent a number of attacks on that only work when the encryption is performed
fields.default_mitigation: Use padding

fields.default_description: The application uses ECB mode in encryption algorithm. ECB mode is known to be weak as it results in the same ciphertext for identical blocks of plaintext.
fields.default_mitigation: Do not use ECB

fields.default_description: The application sends SMS
fields.default_mitigation: The application should send SMS only if it is needed

fields.default_description: The application reads clipboard data
fields.default_mitigation: The application should read clipboard data only if it is needed

fields.default_description: The application is using a weak cryptography algorithm. This means that the application cannot guarantee the confidentiality of sensitive data.
fields.default_mitigation: Upgrade cryptographic algorithm to secure standards like AES (Advanced Encryption Algorithm).

fields.default_description: The application is ussing a weak hashing algorithm. They are known to have collisions
fields.default_mitigation: Use a strong hashing algorithm like sha-2 or sha-512

fields.default_description: The application uses insecure Initialization Vectors. This makes ciphertext much more predictable and susceptible to a dictionary attack
fields.default_mitigation: Use a random IV

fields.default_description: The application is requesting superuser privileges
fields.default_mitigation: The application must never request superuser privileges

fields.default_description: The app uses jackson deserialization library, which is insecure. Deserialization of untrusted input can result in arbitary code execution
fields.default_mitigation: The application must use a secure deseralization library

fields.default_description: The app records media.
fields.default_mitigation: The application should record media only if it is needed

fields.default_description: The application uses notifications using Android Notification Manager
The application downloads files using Android Download Manager

The application does not validate, or incorrectly validates, a certificate. If the host is not checked, it is possible for a redirection or spoofing attack to allow a malicious host with a valid certificate to provide data, impersonating a trusted host. In order to ensure data integrity, the certificate must be valid and it must pertain to the site that is being accessed.
fields.default_mitigation: The certificate's host-specific data must be properly checked

fields.default_description: The application access methods related to Tapjacking attacks
fields.default_mitigation: Do not use dangerous methods that could lead to Tapjacking

fields.default_description: Throwing and Catching overly broad exceptions promotes complex error handling code that is more likely to contain security vulnerabilities.
fields.default_mitigation: Avoid using generic Exceptions

fields.default_description: The application exports a component for use by other applications, but does not properly restrict which applications can launch the component or access the data it contains.
fields.default_mitigation: Because these components have intent filters but have not explicitly set 'android:exported=false' elsewhere in the manifest, they are automatically exported so that any other application can launch them. This may lead to unintended behavior or exploits.

fields.default_description: Android attribute allowBackup allows anyone who can turn on the USB debugging could access application data from the device.
fields.default_mitigation: The application should turn off the application backup feature, set 'android:allowBackup=false

fields.default_description: If an application is marked as debuggable then any attacker would not need root to access the application data and could run arbitary code under that application permission.
fields.default_mitigation: The application should turn off the application debuggable feature, set 'android:debuggable=false

fields.default_description: The application manages user input. Check if validation is performed to avoid injections.
fields.default_mitigation: Make sure that all input are validated and all output is scaped.

fields.default_description: Unless you intend to send data from your app to a different app that you don't own, you should explicitly disallow other developers' apps from accessing the ContentProvider objects that your app contains.
Backup is disabled, this mean that anyone with USB debugging could not access application data from the device.
The application is not marked as debuggable, then any attacker would need root to access the application data and is not able to run arbitary code under that application permission.
The application uses an secure Random Generator
The application is using TLS to encrypt HTTP communication
The application verifies the certificate with SSL Pinning
The application is using cryptography
The application checks if the device has been rooted
The application checks if the device is using Frida
The application checks if the device is debuggable
The application has capabilities to prevent tapjacking attacks
